BusinessName.BusinessNameLine2Txt: PAUL IN THE DIOCESE OF ROCKVILLE CENTRE

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE SOCIETY IS A CATHOLIC LAY ORGANIZAT- ION THAT SEEKS IN A SPIRIT OF JUSTICE AND CHARITY TO HELP THE POOR, THE NEEDY AND THE DISADVANTAGED THROUGH PRACTICAL WORKS OF CHARITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE SOCIETY OFFERS PERSON-TO-PERSON SERVICE TO THE NEEDY AND SUFFERING. WITH APPROXIMATELY 1,350 DEDICATED VINCENTIAN VOLUNTEERS AND 75 EMPLOYEES, SVDPLI PROVIDES FINANCIAL AND MATERIAL ASSISTANCE, ALONG WITH EMOTIONAL AND SPIRITUAL COMFORT TO ANY LONG ISLANDER.
IRS990.Desc: As part of our direct services program which helped approximately 75,000 Long Islanders, our stores offer furniture, clothing, and other household items to people in need, at no cost. This occurs when Vincentians discover during home visits that a family doesn't have proper provisions for everyday living necessities, like a kitchen table on which to feed their children, or adequate beds to get a good night's sleep. In these cases, a furniture and/or clothing request is submitted on behalf of the family by our Vincentians for the items needed. The family is then given a voucher to present to one of our stores that will be fulfilled by a helpful employee.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Vincentian & Community Programs, including a new program for veterans helped over 100,000 Long Islanders. Our Formation and Training Program benefits Vincentians as it delves into the history and spirituality of the Society, and in-depth home visit training. Our Family Assistance Program offers families and veterans in crisis temporary financial aid needed to get back on their feet. The UPLIFT program looks at the underlying root causes of poverty and works one on one with families to elevate them into self-sufficient living. A creative alternative to temporary assistance, UPLIFT empowers people to help themselves by giving them the long-term support to be independent.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Our Dismas House re-entry program departs from traditional institutional settings as our residents are in a safe, protected, and supportive environment that is structured to address the needs of this challenging, yet deserving population. Through on-site and outsourced rehabilitation, including spiritual guidance, our displaced residents develop the skills required to achieve independence. The circumstances of their homelessness vary, but all are given the tools and guidance necessary to support themselves and become productive members of the community.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION B. LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR/CEO AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. FINANCE/AUDIT COMMITTEE MEMBERS,INCLUDING THE PRESIDENT ARE ISSUED A COPY OF THE FINAL 990 THAT WAS FILED WITH THE IRS. ALL BOARD MEMBERS WILL HAVE A COPY AVAILABLE FOR THEIR REVIEW AT THE NEXT BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION B. LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS SIGNS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION B. LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR/CEO'S SALARY WHEN HIRED WAS BASED UPON INDUSTRY STANDARDS FOR NOT FOR PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN THE LONG ISLAND, NEW YORK AREA BASED ON BUDGET SIZE. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR/CEO'S ANNUAL SALARY INCREASE IS THE SAME PERCENTAGE THAT ALL EMPLOYEES RECEIVE AND IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION C. LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FORM 990 ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. THESE FORMS CAN BE VIEWED ON THE SVDPLI WEBSITE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION A LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CURRENT BOARD MEMBER AL MESSINA AND FORMER BOARD MEMBER PHILIP MESSINA ARE BROTHERS
